metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7526 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
libgcrypt before version 1.7.8 is vulnerable to a cache side-channel attack resulting into a complete break of RSA-1024 while using the left-to-right method for computing the sliding-window expansion. The same attack is believed to work on RSA-2048 with moderately more computation. This side-channel requires that attacker can run arbitrary software on the hardware where the private RSA key is used.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7526` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gnupg - 1.4.20-1ubuntu3.3
gnupg-curl - 1.4.20-1ubuntu3.3
gpgv - 1.4.20-1ubuntu3.3
No subscription required

libgcrypt20 - 1.6.5-2ubuntu0.3
No subscription required

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Daniel J. Bernstein, Joachim Breitner, Daniel Genkin, Leon Groot Bruinderink, Nadia Heninger, Tanja Lange, Christine van Vredendaal, and Yuval Yarom

criterions.comment: gnupg package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.4.20-1ubuntu3.3').
libgcrypt20 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.6.5-2ubuntu0.3').
